answers.answer: My friend was induced on a wednesday night at 38w for gd and her and baby went home saturday morning. I went into natural labor on a wednesday night and was also released on saturday morning. I could have went home friday, but the ped suggested I get an extra day to help with breastfeeding.
Here at my hospital in the uk we can stay for 6 hours then go home, I just didn't know if it changed just because I'm being induced and I have gd x
Sorry, I didn't realize you were in the uk. 6 hours? Wow...I kinda liked being able to be at the hospital longer at delivery. I was anemic and was having dizzy spells. :(

If you have a vaginal birth you should go home within 2 days. If you have a cesarean you  may be there for a few more days. I'm not really sure how the UK does things after a cesarean.I'm giving birth at a birth center and I go home in 6 hours which is a huge blessing to me. So long as you have support at home you'll be fine! It's either lay in bed at the hospital with hospital food or go home and be in your own environment with your own smells, your own foods, your shower, etc. and bond with baby while hubby or whoever is there to help and support you.I hope that perspective encourages you if you do go home within several hours of birth!

Oh I am happy to go home after 6 hours, I hate hospitals, I just was not sure on how long after having bubba I cam go home cause I'm being induced at 38 weeks with gd and on medication, I was told baby needs his sugar tested 2hours after birth, I just didn't know that if everything was ok with his sugars if I could then go home after 6 hours. This is my fourth baby and the others all come at 40 weeks on there own, so it is strange having a date to have a baby so strange xx
you have to stay in for 24 hours so that they can do blood sugars on baby, hope that helps
